The men's football firsts produced a superb team performance against Leeds Met Carnegie in the Northern Universities League first division today...

An efficient Sheffield Hallam side beat York firsts 1-0 to leave the footballers still searching for their first BUCS win of the season...

Nouse Sports Editor Adam Shergold reviews a successful day's BUCS action in his weekly round-up...

Netball firsts return to winning ways against Teeside

York firsts defeated Teesside 31- 25 in the most exhilarating netball game so far this season on Wednesday afternoon...

Men tear apart rivals Durham in BUCS lacrosse

Three quarters of dominant lacrosse gave York an easy victory against Durham today as they finally opened their BUCS account in Northern Conference 1B...

By James Bithell

Ski captain Max Hardy reviews last weekend's British University Dry Slope Championships in Edinburgh, with York enjoying a mixed bag in the two-day snowports festival...

Mixed fortunes for York in Saturday's NUL action

York men's football first team beat Lancaster to preserve their unbeaten NUL record today, while the second and third teams struggled...

York women's rugby firsts steamroll Hull

York WRUFC firsts overcame a shaky start to register a comprehensive win over University of Hull firsts yesterday...

Adam Shergold's Wednesday round-up: 5 November

Nouse Sports Editor Adam Shergold reviews all the day's BUCS action in his weekly round-up...

Fencing masterclass from Whitwell gives York win

Captain Harry Whitwell inspired York to a superb fencing victory over the University of Newcastle today in the tent...

Volleyball fight-back can't stop defeat for York men

A spirited fight-back from York was not enough to prevent a straight-sets defeat to a very powerful Sheffield Hallam side in the men's volleyball today...

Doubles strength preserves York's unbeaten start

York men's badminton team continued their unbeaten start to the season with a hard-fought 5-3 victory over Northumbria today...

Football teams storm to victory in NUL matches

A flood of goals for the University of York Football Club saw both the first and second teams romp to resounding victories against Bradford today, winning 4-0 and 6-0 respectively...

York's smooth progression provides kick-start for season

York's hockey team earned comfortable progress into the second round of the BUCS Cup competition at the expense of Leeds University fourths...

York Firsts remind the Fourths why they're number one

An interesting cup draw pitted the University of York Football Club's first team against its fourth team, and there was only ever going to be one winner...

Here Come The Girls!

York Netball team deliver a fantastic result in their first home game against Sunderland

Alex Lacy - York Sport President

Last week was horrendously busy. As the first BUCS Wednesday of the term, it was a red letter day for York Sport, and, as I'm sure is well covered on the rest of these pages, the clubs performed admirably - as they usually do.

Matthew Jeynes

While obviously York is a great university, one of the best in the country, I do sometimes find myself wishing it was like American universities. You know, the ones the size of a small town, in terms of facilities as well as students.
